question: You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to ensure that the generated code is executable when possible. Create an APP: "All Samples" The concept behind this APP is that contemporary beauty product prices are rising, and while we young people don't have income sources, we still want to use high-end brand cosmetics. This APP specifically sells product samples, allowing users to buy authentic products while saving money. The backend uses IDEA, the frontend uses HarmonyOS, and the database uses MySQL.

checklist.title: Is the sample product management system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements sample product categorization, inventory management, and pricing logic through HarmonyOS frontend and IDEA backend. Check if it includes product authentication mechanisms, sample size specifications, and expiration date tracking. Score 0 if core product management is not implemented, 5 if only basic CRUD operations exist, and 10 if comprehensive sample-specific features (batch tracking, authenticity verification, size variants) are fully included.

checklist.title: Is the user shopping and payment system properly integrated?
checklist.description: Check whether the shopping cart, order processing, and payment gateway integration work seamlessly between HarmonyOS frontend and backend services. Verify if sample quantity limits, bulk purchase discounts, and secure payment processing are implemented. Deduct 5 points if payment security measures are missing, and 3 points if order state synchronization fails. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the MySQL database architecture optimized and backend API well-designed?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the database schema efficiently handles sample inventory, user orders, and product relationships with proper indexing and normalization. Check if the IDEA backend provides RESTful APIs with proper error handling and data validation. Deduct 5 points if database queries are not optimized, and 5 points if API responses exceed 500ms. Review connection pooling and transaction management implementation.

checklist.title: Is the HarmonyOS native user experience fully optimized?
checklist.description: Check whether the app leverages HarmonyOS-specific features like distributed capabilities, service widgets, and atomic services. Verify if the UI follows HarmonyOS design guidelines and utilizes platform-specific animations and gestures. Deduct 5 points if generic mobile UI patterns are used instead of HarmonyOS native components, and 3 points if cross-device continuity features are missing. Give 10 points if fully optimized for the platform.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as network failures, payment timeouts, inventory shortages, invalid user inputs, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should effectively handle edge cases like concurrent inventory updates and payment processing failures, giving 10 points. If robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the sample shopping experience (e.g., 1. AR try-on for makeup samples 2. AI-powered shade matching recommendations 3. Social sharing of sample reviews with photos 4. Subscription boxes for curated samples). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple product search mechanisms coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to sample commerce (e.g., built-in social media feeds) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive product image animations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if core shopping functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating business logic/presentation/data layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation for both HarmonyOS frontend and IDEA backend. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if CI/CD pipeline and automated testing are not implemented. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern e-commerce and beauty industry design principles: 1) Harmonious color palette suitable for beauty products (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing following HarmonyOS design guidelines (element spacing follows 8dp grid system) 3) Professional typography system (body font size ≥ 14sp, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for unprofessional color combinations, and 5 points for chaotic product layout.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to HarmonyOS interaction patterns and human perception: 1) Touch feedback delay ≤ 100ms for product selection 2) Transition animations between screens controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance for shopping flow 4) Smooth product image loading and zooming. Deduct 5 points for each operation without proper feedback, 3 points for visual artifacts during scrolling, and 5 points if key shopping actions (add to cart, checkout) are hard to locate.
